comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Pulitzer was presenting a gift -- a bronze statue of Thomas Jefferson -- to Columbia University, in a ceremony at the Columbia University School of Journalism, held during Commencement Week, (June 2, 1914). The statue, not yet unveiled, is here shrouded in U. S. flags.

Other Bain/LOC photos of the unveiling ceremony:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5496669463/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Wystan: Thanks for the information on this event and the gathering of related photographs. The statue, a gift of the Joseph Pulitzer estate, was actually unveiled in a ceremony on June 2, rather than on Commencement Day, per this New York Times article. We will add these details to this record and to the other related photographs when we update.
